titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the U.S. Forest Service, George Washington National Forest, Lost River and Massanutten Working Circles Reports, 1912-1940

defitem.label: Processed by:
defitem.item: Chris Bolgiano, March 1990; Edited by Kayla Payne, June 2012

did.unittitle: U.S. Forest Service, George Washington National Forest, Lost River and Massanutten Working Circles Reports,
did.abstract: This collection consists of photocopies of four public-domain documents which relate to the U.S. Forest Service.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection. Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the James Madison University Special Collections Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have been transferred to the James Madison University Special Collections Library. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library Reference Desk. (library-special@jmu.edu).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], [box #, folder #], U.S. Forest Service, George Washington National Forest, Lost River and Massanutten Working Circles Reports, 1912-1940, SC 0106, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by John Coleman, Lee District Ranger for the George Washington National Forest, in March 1997.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In order to streamline the process of applying collection numbers, Special Collections staff completed a large-scale renumbering campaign in the spring of 2017. This collection was previously cataloged as SC 2086.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of four reports documenting the forest composition and condition of certain portions of federally owned lands in northern Rockingham and Page counties; and in western Frederick and western Shenandoah counties in Virginia and southeastern Hampshire and eastern Hardy counties, West Virginia. Details about local markets for forest products; local history of tanbark, iron, and other industries; and local fire history are also given. Titles include:

list.item: Report on the technical examination of the lands of the Allegheny Ore and Iron Co., Rockingham and Page Counties, VA, 1912 (a copy of the original and a transcript of the poorly typed original are included)
Revision of Lost River Working Circle, Shenandoah National Forest, 1924
Development plan for Lost River Working Circle, George Washington National Forest, 1939
Development plan for the Massanutten Working Circle, George Washington National Forest, 1940

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The reports are arranged chronologically in one folder.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Original documents on file at the Lee District headquarters in Edinburg, Virginia

p.extref: U.S. Forest Service, George Washington National Forest, Dry River District Records, SC 0083, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.
